hypothesis_content.title: Fade the 'News Spike' in Low Regime Confidence Environments
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime with confidence below 65%, a sharp (>3%) 1-hour price spike in BTC on high volume (≥1.5x 20-period average) triggered by a major headline will fully retrace (>70% of the spike) within the next 6 trading hours, providing a high-probability short-term mean reversion opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In low-conviction neutral markets, liquidity is often thin and reactions to news are emotional and overdone. Algorithmic and high-frequency traders frequently step in to fade these illiquid spikes, leading to rapid retracements as the initial knee-jerk reaction dissipates and the underlying regime lack of trend reasserts itself.
entry_conditions: BTC has a 1H candle with: a) return ≥ |3%|, b) volume ≥ 1.5x 20-period avg
A major news headline is identified by news-scan (e.g., 'Fed', 'ETF', 'regulation', 'hack') within 30 mins of candle start
Entry: Limit order placed at price level representing a 50% retracement of the 1H spike candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the opening level of the initial 1H spike candle (100% retracement)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves beyond the high/low of the initial 1H spike candle by 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of such spikes retrace at least 70% of their move within 6 hours in the specified regime context.
